raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Factitious disorder", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "The patient presented with severe hypoglycemia (glucose 35 mg/dL), but her Hgb A1c is normal (5.1%), suggesting no chronic hyperglycemia. Importantly, her C-peptide is decreased, which means endogenous insulin secretion is low. In cases of exogenous insulin administration (as in factitious disorder or Munchausen syndrome), C-peptide is low because exogenous insulin suppresses endogenous insulin production. In insulinoma, C-peptide would be elevated due to increased endogenous insulin. Hypothyroidism and somatization disorder do not cause hypoglycemia. The psychosocial stressor (divorce) may be a contributing factor to factitious behavior.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
